content: Heaven Is God’s Throne
This is what the  says,
Hypocrisy Rebuked
“He who kills an ox [for pagan sacrifice] is [as guilty] as one who kills a man;
He who sacrifices a lamb, as one who breaks a dog’s neck;
He who offers a grain offering,  swine’s blood;
He who offers incense, as one who blesses an idol.
Such people have chosen their own ways,
And their soul delights in their repulsive acts;
So I will choose their punishments,
And will bring the things they dread upon them
Because I called, but no one answered;
I spoke, but they did not listen  obey.
But they did evil in My sight
And chose that in which I did not delight.”
Hear the word of the , you who tremble [with awe-filled reverence] at His word:
“Your brothers who hate you, who exclude you for My Name’s sake,
Have said, ‘Let the  be glorified, that we may see your joy.’
But they will be put to shame.
“The sound of an uproar from the city! A voice from the temple!
The voice of the , providing retribution to His enemies.
Joy in Jerusalem’s Future
“Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her, all you who love her;
Rejoice greatly with her, all you who mourn over her,
That you may nurse and be satisfied with her comforting breasts,
That you may drink deeply and be delighted with her bountiful bosom.”
For the  says this, “Behold, I extend peace to her (Jerusalem) like a river,
And the glory of the nations like an overflowing stream;
And you will be nursed, you will be carried on  hip and [playfully] rocked on  knees.
“As one whom his mother comforts, so I will comfort you;
And you will be comforted in Jerusalem.”
When you see this, your heart will rejoice;
Your bones will flourish like new grass.
And the [powerful] hand of the  will be revealed to His servants,
But His indignation will be toward His enemies.
For indeed, the  will come in fire
And His chariots will be like the stormy wind,
To render His anger with rage,
And His rebuke with flames of fire.
For the  will execute judgment by fire
And by His sword on all mankind,
And those slain by the  will be many.
“Those who [vainly attempt to] sanctify and cleanse themselves  to the gardens [to sacrifice to idols],
Following after one in the center,
Who eat swine’s flesh, detestable things and mice,
Will come to an end together,” says the .
“For I know their works and their thoughts.  is coming to gather all nations and languages, and they will come and see My glory.

I will set up a [miraculous] sign among them, and from them I will send survivors to the nations: Tarshish, Pul (Put), Lud, Meshech, Tubal and Javan, to the distant islands  coastlands that have not heard of My fame nor seen My glory. And they will declare  proclaim My glory among the nations.

Then they shall bring all your countrymen (children of Israel) from all the nations as a grain offering to the —on horses, in chariots, in litters, on mules and on camels—to My holy mountain Jerusalem,” says the , “just as the sons of Israel bring their grain offering in a clean vessel to the house of the .
I will also take some of them as priests and Levites,” says the .
